alert.note: Alert for South Washington Cascades (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 19 at 8:56PM PST until January 21 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Portland
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SUNDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation possible. Ice accumulations of around one half of an inch and total snow accumulations of up to one inch, except up to 5 inches above 4000 feet possible. * WHERE...South Washington Cascades. * WHEN...From Saturday afternoon through Sunday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Power outages and tree damage are likely due to the ice. Travel will be difficult. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The bulk of the ice accumulation is expected in southern Skamania County near the Columbia River Gorge. Ice accumulation currently lingering on trees, powerlines, untreated roads and untreated sidewalks will not have a chance to melt prior to the onset of the next round of freezing rain expected Saturday afternoon into Sunday afternoon. As a result, any amount of additional ice accumulation will further increase the risk of downed trees and powerlines.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
